fields.question: What are Dim Lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are to be used at all times, as one should not risk blinding other drivers
fields.opt_2: Lights which are switched on when it is getting dark. They are also switched on for a short distance viewing of oncoming vehicles
fields.opt_3: Lights found inside the vehicle cabin that serve those inside the vehicle
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to indicate one's intention to turn
fields.right_opt: Lights which are switched on when it is getting dark. They are also switched on for a short distance viewing of oncoming vehicles

fields.question: What are parking dim lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are turned on when a vehicle is at a stop
fields.opt_2: Lights that indicates one's intention to park their vehicle
fields.opt_3: Lights used in low visibility conditions where a lot of light is necessary
fields.opt_4: Lights that are switched on at 6: 45 AM or when it is raining or dusty.
fields.right_opt: Lights that are switched on at 6: 45 AM or when it is raining or dusty.

fields.question: What are full lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights used in at night
fields.opt_2: Lights used on highways to enable the driver see further
fields.opt_3: Lights that are to be used at all times irrespective of the environmental conditions
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to indicate one's intention to turn
fields.right_opt: Lights used on highways to enable the driver see further

fields.question: What are hazard lights?
fields.opt_1: These are vehicle lights that flash at the front and back of the car. They are switched on when they is a hazard or danger.
fields.opt_2: Hazard lights are used to indicate that one needs to stop immediately
fields.opt_3: They can also be used when overtaking at high speed
fields.opt_4: They can best be used at night when visibility is high
fields.right_opt: These are vehicle lights that flash at the front and back of the car. They are switched on when they is a hazard or danger.

fields.question: What are Indicator lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights used to signal other drivers of one's intention to stop
fields.opt_2: Lights that turn on automatically when one applies the brakes
fields.opt_3: Lights that are only used when its necessary to alert other drivers that one is turning
fields.opt_4: Lights that are used to provide signals to other users when changing lanes, reversing and parking.
fields.right_opt: Lights that are used to provide signals to other users when changing lanes, reversing and parking.

fields.question: What are brake lights?
fields.opt_1: Lights that are only used when its necessary to alert other drivers that one is turning
fields.opt_2: These are lights that indicate the vehicle is applying brakes.
fields.opt_3: Lights that generally indicate danger
fields.opt_4: Lights that are only used in low visibility conditions
fields.right_opt: These are lights that indicate the vehicle is applying brakes.

fields.question: When can you turn on the lights during day time?
fields.opt_1: When its foggy
fields.opt_2: During heavy rainfall
fields.opt_3: When its misty
fields.opt_4: During emergency
fields.right_opt: In all the above situations

fields.question: What is a vehicle?
fields.opt_1: A four wheeled machine used for transportation
fields.opt_2: A form of transportation
fields.opt_3: A type of industrial machine
fields.opt_4: An automobile power driven machine
fields.right_opt: an automobile power driven machine

fields.question: What is a lane?
fields.opt_1: A path used by pedestrians
fields.opt_2: Is a type of road
fields.opt_3: It is a path to be followed by the vehicle
fields.opt_4: Is a road made of tarmac
fields.right_opt: It is a path to be followed by the vehicle

fields.question: Who is a pedestrian?
fields.opt_1: Any road user
fields.opt_2: A motorcylce rider
fields.opt_3: A person who does not own a car
fields.opt_4: Road users on foot
fields.right_opt: Road users on foot

fields.question: Kenyan drivers are supposed to drive on which side of the road?
fields.opt_1: Always keep left unless overtaking
fields.opt_2: Always keep right unless overtaking
fields.opt_3: Drivers are free to switch to their preffered side
fields.opt_4: None of the above is correct
fields.right_opt: Always keep left unless overtaking

fields.question: Which side do you overtake from in Kenya?
fields.opt_1: From the left side
fields.opt_2: From the right side
fields.opt_3: From any side, depending on traffic conditions
fields.opt_4: All the above are true
fields.right_opt: From the right side

fields.question: Which one of the following is NOT one of the three documents which must be valid before you are allowed to drive?
fields.opt_1: Valid driving license
fields.opt_2: Valid Identification Card
fields.opt_3: Valid insurance certificate
fields.opt_4: Valid vehicle inspection certificate
fields.right_opt: Valid Identification Card

fields.question: Which category of vehicles do NOT have a right of way?
fields.opt_1: Ambulance with siren
fields.opt_2: Fire engine with a siren
fields.opt_3: Public Service Vehicles
fields.opt_4: Presidential escort with siren
fields.right_opt: Public Service Vehicles

fields.question: What is the maximum driving speed limit in town?
fields.opt_1: 50Km/h
fields.opt_2: 80Km/h
fields.opt_3: 70Km/h
fields.opt_4: 100Km/h
fields.right_opt: 50Km/h

fields.question: Which of the following maximum speed limits is NOT legal when applied on a highway?
fields.opt_1: Cars - 110Km/h
fields.opt_2: Pickups/lorries - 80Km/h
fields.opt_3: Motorcycles - 50Km/h
fields.opt_4: Trailers  - 65Km/h
fields.right_opt: Motorcycles - 50Km/h

fields.question: When are you not allowed to drive despite having the three valid required documents?
fields.opt_1: When medicated
fields.opt_2: When you are sick
fields.opt_3: Drunk
fields.opt_4: In all the above situations
fields.right_opt: In all the above situations

fields.question: What is the Highway Code?
fields.opt_1: The highway code is a booklet that records all traffic violations a driver makes
fields.opt_2: Highway code is a booklet checked and passed by the parliament for rules of road users in Kenya
fields.opt_3: The highway code is part of one's drivers license
fields.opt_4: Includes laws put in place by traffic officers to control vehicle flow
fields.right_opt: Highway code is a booklet checked and passed by the parliament for rules of road users in Kenya

fields.question: What do you look for when driving past stationery vehicle?
fields.opt_1: Opening of doors
fields.opt_2: Pedestrian crossing
fields.opt_3: Oncoming traffic
fields.opt_4: Option A & B
fields.right_opt: Option A & B

fields.question: Which one of the following is NOT one of the four important tools you must carry when driving for a safari?
fields.opt_1: Car jack
fields.opt_2: Spare wheel
fields.opt_3: Spot light
fields.opt_4: Reflective triangle
fields.right_opt: Reflective triangle

fields.question: The following are the four main causes of accidents in Kenya, EXCEPT?.
fields.opt_1: Carelessness
fields.opt_2: Lane violations
fields.opt_3: Over-speeding
fields.opt_4: Drunkenness
fields.right_opt: Lane violations

fields.question: How many wheels does a saloon car have?
fields.opt_1: Four
fields.opt_2: Six
fields.opt_3: Five
fields.opt_4: Eight
fields.right_opt: Five

fields.question: How many eyes does a driver have?
fields.opt_1: Three - two natural and one artificial
fields.opt_2: Two, as they are only human
fields.opt_3: Four - two natural and two artificial
fields.opt_4: One - as they only focus on one direction
fields.right_opt: Three - two natural and one artificial

fields.question: What should you do first when receiving your driving license for the first time?
fields.opt_1: Laminate and place on your dashboard
fields.opt_2: You can start driving immediately
fields.opt_3: Check all the details are correct and sign in ink pen
fields.opt_4: Use it as a form of identification in place of your ID
fields.right_opt: Check all the details are correct and sign in ink pen

fields.question: When there is a white continuous line down a one way traffic road what does it mean?
fields.opt_1: Ensures that all lanes on the road are visible
fields.opt_2: It means no changing lane
fields.opt_3: It means the road may have a lot of traffic, meaning it is important to observe lane discipline
fields.opt_4: Its just a decoration used on tarmac roads
fields.right_opt: It means no changing lane

fields.question: Within what period should an accident be reported at a police station?
fields.opt_1: Within five hours after the incident
fields.opt_2: Within a week after the incident
fields.opt_3: Only reported when there is is serious damage or harm
fields.opt_4: As soon as possible but within 24hours
fields.right_opt: As soon as possible but within 24hours

fields.question: What is the pedestrian crossing?
fields.opt_1: A crossing meant for school children
fields.opt_2: A safe crossing provided for safe use of pedestrians
fields.opt_3: A crossing located in areas with high pedestrian traffic
fields.opt_4: A crossing found at an intersection or T junction
fields.right_opt: A safe crossing provided for safe use of pedestrians

fields.question: The following are the rules of the model town board, EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: Use the shortest and the most correct route with using parking
fields.opt_2: Use the shortest and the most correct route without using parking
fields.opt_3: Use the longest and the most correct route without using parking
fields.opt_4: Use parking if there is no any other route
fields.right_opt: Use the shortest and the most correct route with using parking

fields.question: Green color on the traffic lights means go except?
fields.opt_1: When there is on coming vehicle from right
fields.opt_2: When stopped by a police officer
fields.opt_3: Only B
fields.opt_4: Both A & B
fields.right_opt: Both A & B

fields.question: The following include the four key places you cannot stop EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: On round about
fields.opt_2: At the entrance of a hospital
fields.opt_3: At the center of the road
fields.opt_4: Where there is no stopping sign
fields.right_opt: At the entrance of a hospital

fields.question: Considering the following locations, Where should you overtake?
fields.opt_1: On a highway
fields.opt_2: At the junction
fields.opt_3: Where there is a NO overtaking sign
fields.opt_4: On the round about
fields.right_opt: On a highway

fields.question: You should stop in all the following situations, EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: At the stop sign
fields.opt_2: When ordered by the police
fields.opt_3: When the traffic lights changes to red
fields.opt_4: To make way for government officials
fields.right_opt: To make way for government officials

fields.question: When do you use the mirror when driving?
fields.opt_1: When overtaking
fields.opt_2: Changing lane
fields.opt_3: Stopping
fields.opt_4: In all the above situations
fields.right_opt: In all the above situations

fields.question: What distance should you keep between two moving vehicles in town?
fields.opt_1: A reasonable distance as judged by a driver
fields.opt_2: You should see the behind wheels or the number plate of the vehicle infront
fields.opt_3: At least two metres
fields.opt_4: At least two vehicle lengths
fields.right_opt: You should see the behind wheels or the number plate of the vehicle infront

fields.question: What is the meaning of the letter EAK found at the outer cover of a driving license?
fields.opt_1: East Africa / Kenya
fields.opt_2: East African Community
fields.opt_3: East African Transport Authority
fields.opt_4: East African Transport Association
fields.right_opt: East Africa / Kenya

fields.question: How should a driver control himself in an uncontrolled roundabout?
fields.opt_1: You should make sure there is no oncoming vehicle from the left side of the round about
fields.opt_2: You should make sure there is no oncoming vehicle from any side of the round about
fields.opt_3: Be patient and follow other vehicles
fields.opt_4: You should make sure there is no oncoming vehicle from the right side of the round about
fields.right_opt: You should make sure there is no oncoming vehicle from the right side of the round about

fields.question: The following are the don'ts of holding a steering wheel, EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: Don't crisscross hands
fields.opt_2: Don't hold with only one hand
fields.opt_3: Don't hold with the elbow
fields.opt_4: Don't turn the steering wheel too quickly
fields.opt_5: Don't grip the steering wheel very firmly
fields.right_opt: Don't turn the steering wheel too quickly

fields.question: What is the name given to anybody carrying a sign of STOP CHILDREN CROSSING?
fields.opt_1: School staff
fields.opt_2: School warden
fields.opt_3: School conductor
fields.opt_4: Teacher
fields.right_opt: School warden

fields.question: Why do we normally press down the clutch peddle when engaging gear?
fields.opt_1: To disconnect the gear box from the engine
fields.opt_2: To effectively activate the new gear position selected
fields.opt_3: To save conserve fuel by shifting gears slowly
fields.opt_4: Its a required procedure
fields.right_opt: To disconnect the gear box from the engine

fields.question: What must you NOT do when being overtaken?
fields.opt_1: Stay focussed on your driving and avoid getting distracted by staring at the other driver
fields.opt_2: You should give the overtaking vehicle the space they need by keeping left
fields.opt_3: You should not accelerate
fields.opt_4: You should slow donw to make it easier for them to overtake quickly
fields.right_opt: You should not accelerate

fields.question: When can you overtake from left?
fields.opt_1: When the vehicle in-front is turning right
fields.opt_2: When driving on a one way traffic road with more than one lane
fields.opt_3: When there is an accident on the right and there is space on the left
fields.opt_4: All the above are true
fields.right_opt: All the above are true

fields.question: In which of the folowing scenarios can lights NOT be dimmed at night?
fields.opt_1: When meeting a pedestrian
fields.opt_2: When meeting on coming vehicle
fields.opt_3: On a well lit area
fields.opt_4: In dark environments where visibility is poor
fields.right_opt: In dark environments where visibility is poor

fields.question: In which of the following areas are you ALLOWED to HOOT
fields.opt_1: Near hospital
fields.opt_2: Near school
fields.opt_3: Near law court
fields.opt_4: Where there is NO hooting sign
fields.right_opt: In a busy street

fields.question: What time do you switch on light in the evening?
fields.opt_1: 6:30 pm parking lights 6:45pm head light
fields.opt_2: 6:30 pm head light 6:45pm parking lights
fields.opt_3: 7:30 pm parking head 7:45pm head light
fields.opt_4: 7:30 pm head light 7:45pm parking lights
fields.right_opt: 6:30 pm parking lights 6:45pm head light

fields.question: What do you do before getting out of the vehicle?
fields.opt_1: Turn the vehicle off and remove your seat belt
fields.opt_2: Pull up the handbrake
fields.opt_3: Check the side mirror or look over your right shoulder
fields.opt_4: Make sure the car is locked
fields.right_opt: Check the side mirror or look over your right shoulder

fields.question: Which of the following parts of a car MAY NOT be regulalrly maintained
fields.opt_1: Brakes
fields.opt_2: Radio and sound system
fields.opt_3: Steering wheel
fields.opt_4: Wheels
fields.right_opt: Radio and sound system

fields.question: When are you NOT allowed to park?
fields.opt_1: At the corner of the road
fields.opt_2: Where there is no parking sign
fields.opt_3: At the junction
fields.opt_4: At the bus stop
fields.right_opt: In all the above areas

fields.question: What is a caravan?
fields.opt_1: Its part of a trailer
fields.opt_2: It is a mobile car without engine pulled with an engine car and it can be use for accommodation
fields.opt_3: Refers to several vehicles moving together in a line
fields.opt_4: Its the passenger cabin of a bus
fields.right_opt: It is a mobile car without engine pulled with an engine car and it can be use for accommodation

fields.question: What should you do when approaching uncontrolled railway crossing at?
fields.opt_1: At all times - dim lights, check if the train is close by
fields.opt_2: Night - stop, dim lights listen if there is no sound,proceed
fields.opt_3: Daytime - stop, look left and right listen if there is no sound proceed
fields.opt_4: Both B and C
fields.right_opt: Both B and C

fields.question: The following are common mistakes made when approaching a round about, EXCEPT ONE, identify it.
fields.opt_1: Approaching the roundabout with wrong lane
fields.opt_2: Changing lanes on the roundabout
fields.opt_3: Checking for traffic on one's right side
fields.opt_4: Leaving the roundabout the wrong lane
fields.right_opt: Checking for traffic on one's right side

fields.question: Whats the best way of keeping your vehicle roadworthy?
fields.opt_1: Ensure Your wheels are in a good condition
fields.opt_2: Ensure all Lights are in a good condition
fields.opt_3: Keep the steering wheel in a good condition
fields.opt_4: Ensure your brakes are working
fields.right_opt: All the above are true

fields.question: Describe your approach at a pedestrian crossing?
fields.opt_1: Alert and at a speed of which he can control and stop incase of emergency
fields.opt_2: Alert but at a reasonable speed if there is no traffic
fields.opt_3: Alert but at a slow speed
fields.opt_4: All of the above are true
fields.right_opt: Alert and at a speed of which he can control and stop incase of emergency

fields.question: How do you hold the steering wheel clockwise?
fields.opt_1: 8 to 0 position and ¼ to 3 position
fields.opt_2: 10 to 2 position and 2 to 3 position
fields.opt_3: 10 to 2 position and ¼ to 3 position
fields.opt_4: 8 to 0 position and ¼ to 2 position
fields.right_opt: 10 to 2 position and ¼ to 3 position

fields.question: What do you do if, as crossing by the traffic lights is green then they suddenly change to amber?
fields.opt_1: You should stop and wait for pedestrians to cross
fields.opt_2: You should proceed as the light was green when crossing
fields.opt_3: You should proceed if you had crossed the stop sign
fields.opt_4: You should proceed if there are no pedestrians
fields.right_opt: You should proceed if you had crossed the stop sign

fields.question: What is the correct position at the junction when turning?
fields.opt_1: left : drive at an extreme left, right : drive at an extreme right
fields.opt_2: left : drive at an extreme right, right : drive at an extreme left
fields.opt_3: left : drive in any lane, right : drive at an extreme right
fields.opt_4: left : drive at an extreme left, right : drive in any lane
fields.right_opt: left : drive at an extreme left, right : drive at an extreme right

fields.question: What does the green arrow filter on the traffic lights mean?
fields.opt_1: You should proceed to where you intend to go
fields.opt_2: You should stop as there is traffic oming from the direction indicated
fields.opt_3: You should go to any direction you please
fields.opt_4: You should go to the direction shown by the arrows
fields.right_opt: You should go to the direction shown by the arrows

fields.question: The following vehicles are taken for inspection EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: Trailers
fields.opt_2: Pickups
fields.opt_3: Lorries
fields.opt_4: Personal Cars
fields.right_opt: Personal Cars

fields.question: Which is the strongest gear on a vehicle and why?
fields.opt_1: Gear One - the lowest gear
fields.opt_2: Reverse gear because it has no any other alternative gear
fields.opt_3: Gear Three - One of the highest in most vehicles
fields.opt_4: All gears have the same power
fields.right_opt: Reverse gear because it has no any other alternative gear

fields.question: Why should you look right twice when approaching a junction?
fields.opt_1: Vehicles coming from both behind on your right and from your right side of the jucntion, which increases the danger of a collision
fields.opt_2: Most vehicles will try to overtake from the right side
fields.opt_3: The left side has slow moving traffic
fields.opt_4: So as to note any oncoming vehicles
fields.right_opt: Vehicles coming from both behind on your right and from your Right side of the jucntion, which increases the danger of a collision

fields.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the steps that should be followed when overtaking another vehicle
fields.opt_1: Start indicating right
fields.opt_2: Determine is right lane is clear, - If its clear you overtake
fields.opt_3: After overtaking you indicate to the left and keep to  your side
fields.opt_4: Slow down after successfully overtaking
fields.right_opt: Slow down after successfully overtaking

fields.question: When the traffic lights show green and you are stopped by police officer, who should you obey?
fields.opt_1: You should politely telll the officer you cannot stop because of the lights
fields.opt_2: You should obey police because it is mandatory to do so
fields.opt_3: You should obey the traffic lights because it is mandatory to do so
fields.opt_4: You should proceed if you are sure there is nothing wrong
fields.right_opt: You should obey police because it is mandatory to do so

fields.question: What is a hard shoulder way?
fields.opt_1: A lane reserved for emergency vehicles such as ambulances
fields.opt_2: An emergency lane that runs along the left-hand side of a motorway carriageway
fields.opt_3: A lane reserved for personal cars and public transport vehicles
fields.opt_4: A lane for high speed vehicles on a highway
fields.right_opt: an emergency lane that runs along the left-hand side of a motorway carriageway

fields.question: What is another name given to a give way sign?
fields.opt_1: Yield sign
fields.opt_2: Stop sign
fields.opt_3: Slow down sign
fields.opt_4: Turn sign
fields.right_opt: Yield sign

fields.question: What is the different between a street and an avenue?
fields.opt_1: A street is usually larger than an avenue
fields.opt_2: Avenues have lower speed limits when compared to streets
fields.opt_3: A street is where buildings are on both sides of the road, while an Avenue is where vegetation is on both sides of the road
fields.opt_4: Both streets and avenues are parallell to each other and not perpendicular
fields.right_opt: A street is where buildings are on both sides of the road, while an Avenue is where vegetation is on both sides of the road

fields.question: What is the meaning of AMBER which keeps on flushing every now and then in the traffic lights?
fields.opt_1: Control yourself
fields.opt_2: Stop for crossing pedestrians
fields.opt_3: Proceed with Caution
fields.opt_4: Proceed at prescribed speed limit
fields.right_opt: Control yourself

fields.question: Which mechanical signal should we put on after involved in a road accident in the middle of the road?
fields.opt_1: Stop sign
fields.opt_2: Hazard light
fields.opt_3: Yield sign
fields.opt_4: Slow down sign
fields.right_opt: Hazard light

fields.question: Which gear should be used to start a loaded lorry and why?
fields.opt_1: Gear number one because it is more strong than number two
fields.opt_2: Gear number three because it is more strong than number one and two
fields.opt_3: Gear number two because it is more strong than number one and three
fields.opt_4: Any gear would do
fields.right_opt: Gear number one because it is more strong than number two

fields.question: Which is the biggest roundabout in East Africa?
fields.opt_1: Nyayo round about
fields.opt_2: T-mall round about
fields.opt_3: Globe cinema round about
fields.opt_4: Kenyatta road round about
fields.right_opt: Globe cinema round about

fields.question: Why are commercial vehicles taken for inspection?
fields.opt_1: To check if they violated any traffic rules
fields.opt_2: To identify any disallowed modifications
fields.opt_3: To make sure they are in good condition and road worthy
fields.opt_4: To ensure the staff using them are qualified
fields.right_opt: To make sure they are in good condition and road worthy

fields.question: What is the meaning of MS in driving?
fields.opt_1: Mechanic sign
fields.opt_2: Machine signal
fields.opt_3: Marching sign
fields.opt_4: Mechanical signal
fields.right_opt: Mechanical signal

fields.question: Why is the headlight of motorbikes on always even during the day time?
fields.opt_1: For better visibility
fields.opt_2: To be seen by other road users
fields.opt_3: Due to their high speed
fields.opt_4: Its how motorbikes are designed to work
fields.right_opt: To be seen by other road users

fields.question: Which signs are circled?
fields.opt_1: Warning signs
fields.opt_2: Mandatory and regulatory signs
fields.opt_3: Information signs
fields.opt_4: Priority signs
fields.right_opt: Mandatory and regulatory signs

fields.question: Which signs are triangle?
fields.opt_1: Warning and hazard or cautionary
fields.opt_2: Information signs
fields.opt_3: Priority signs
fields.opt_4: Mandatory and regulatory signs
fields.right_opt: Warning and hazard or cautionary

fields.question: Which signs have the apex facing upwards?
fields.opt_1: Information signs
fields.opt_2: Priority signs
fields.opt_3: Mandatory and regulatory signs
fields.opt_4: Warning signs
fields.right_opt: Warning signs

fields.question: Why do we observe regulatory signs?
fields.opt_1: To minimize the possibility of accidents
fields.opt_2: Because traffic laws require that they be observed
fields.opt_3: For efficient traffic flow
fields.opt_4: Its good practice while driving
fields.right_opt: Because they are signs to be observed

fields.question: What do we call the two major signs in Kenya?
fields.opt_1: Mandatory and regulatory signs
fields.opt_2: Warning signs
fields.opt_3: Information signs
fields.opt_4: Priority signs
fields.right_opt: Priority signs

fields.question: What is the difference between heavy and light commercial vehicles?
fields.opt_1: Heavy commercial vehicle are those vehicles which are exceeding 3.05 tonnes tire weight and light commercial vehicle have less than that weight
fields.opt_2: Heavy commercial vehicle are those vehicles which are exceeding 5.05 tonnes tire weight and light commercial vehicle have less than that weight
fields.opt_3: Heavy commercial vehicle are those vehicles which are exceeding 2.05 tonnes tire weight and light commercial vehicle have less than that weight
fields.opt_4: Heavy commercial vehicle are those vehicles which are exceeding 1.05 tonnes tire weight and light commercial vehicle have less than that weight
fields.right_opt: Heavy commercial vehicle are those vehicles which are exceeding 3.05 tonnes tire weight and light commercial vehicle have less than that weight

fields.question: What is the difference between railway crossing and level crossing?
fields.opt_1: Railway crossing are those crossing found in the urban areas while level crossing are those crossings found in rural area
fields.opt_2: Railway crossing are those connecting railway and road networks while level crossing are those connecting two roads
fields.opt_3: Railway crossing are those crossing found in the rural areas while level crossing are those crossings found in urban area
fields.opt_4: There is no clear distinction between the two
fields.right_opt: Railway crossing are those crossing found in the rural areas while level crossing are those crossings found in urban area

fields.question: What is hazard demarcation?
fields.opt_1: Signs that generally indicate danger
fields.opt_2: Are reflective plates attached at the edge of the bridge to show then width on the bridge at night
fields.opt_3: Signs placed on the road when one's vehicle breaks down
fields.opt_4: Areas of a road that are closed off due to repairs that are in progress
fields.right_opt: Are reflective plates attached at the edge of the bridge to show then width on the bridge at night

fields.question: Define term “horn” in a vehicle?
fields.opt_1: A sound made by a vehicle to alert others of one's presence
fields.opt_2: It is a instrument used to alert other road users of your presence
fields.opt_3: Its part of the sound system of a vehicle
fields.opt_4: Its part of the engine
fields.right_opt: It is a instrument used to alert other road users of your presence

fields.question: What is hooting?
fields.opt_1: It is a sound produced by a horn
fields.opt_2: A means of expressing one's frustration with other drivers
fields.opt_3: A way of greeting others one sees when driving
fields.opt_4: All of the above are true
fields.right_opt: It is a sound produced by a horn

fields.question: The following are the THREE ways one should HOOT, EXCEPT?
fields.opt_1: Thrice means an alert signal
fields.opt_2: Once means warning
fields.opt_3: Twice means greeting
fields.opt_4: Several times means abusing
fields.right_opt: Thrice means an alert signal

fields.question: What is the main function of clutch pedal on a vehicle?
fields.opt_1: To reduce the speed of the vehicle when changing gears
fields.opt_2: To connect and disconnect the gear box from the engine
fields.opt_3: To manage fuel consumption
fields.opt_4: To aid in the process of changing gears
fields.right_opt: To connect and disconnect the gear box from the engine

fields.question: Which ONE of the following is not a Category of Traffic Signs?
fields.opt_1: Mandatory
fields.opt_2: Warning
fields.opt_3: Speed
fields.opt_4: Information
fields.right_opt: Speed

fields.question: When you intend to turn what distance should you start indicating?
fields.opt_1: You should start indicating at a distance of 50m in advance
fields.opt_2: You should start indicating at a distance of 30m in advance
fields.opt_3: You should start indicating at a distance of 200m in advance
fields.opt_4: You should start indicating at a distance of 10m in advance
fields.right_opt: You should start indicating at a distance of 50m in advance

fields.question: What is the difference between turning left and passing left?
fields.opt_1: When passing left there is a complete change of direction to be made but turning left means to keep left
fields.opt_2: When turning left there is a complete change of direction to the right but passing left means to turning to the left
fields.opt_3: When turning left there is a complete change of direction to be made but passing left means to keep left
fields.opt_4: There is no major difference between the two
fields.right_opt: When turning left there is a complete change of direction to be made but passing left means to keep left

fields.question: What is an ”engine”?
fields.opt_1: A device that powers the headlights of the vehicle
fields.opt_2: A device that controls the AC and radio
fields.opt_3: Its the most important part of a vehicle
fields.opt_4: A power generating machine that keep the vehicle in motion
fields.right_opt: A power generating machine that keep the vehicle in motion

fields.question: What is the main purpose of a Driving license?
fields.opt_1: Is an important part of one's identification
fields.opt_2: To allow you to drive on roads within east Africa
fields.opt_3: To be used for job applications
fields.opt_4: To be inspected by traffic officers where necessary
fields.right_opt: To allow you to drive on roads within east Africa

fields.question: What is the main purpose of an Insurance certificate
fields.opt_1: To minimize costs in case of a negative incident
fields.opt_2: To comply with legal requirements
fields.opt_3: To benefit insurance companies
fields.opt_4: For security purposes
fields.right_opt: For security purposes

fields.question: What is the main purpose of a Vehicle inspection certificate
fields.opt_1: To show the road worthiness of a vehicle
fields.opt_2: To ensure a vehicle has all required modifications
fields.opt_3: To earn revenue for the traffic department
fields.opt_4: To assure the public about the quality of a vehicle
fields.right_opt: To show the road worthiness of a vehicle

fields.question: What is coasting?
fields.opt_1: It is driving a vehicle for a long distance only with one gear
fields.opt_2: It is driving a vehicle for a short distance only with one gear
fields.opt_3: It is driving a vehicle for a medium distance only with one gear
fields.opt_4: It is driving a vehicle for a short distance only with two gears
fields.right_opt: It is driving a vehicle for a long distance only with one gear

fields.question: What is three point turn in driving?
fields.opt_1: It is driving a vehicle facing to the right direction with use of reverse and forward gear
fields.opt_2: It is driving a vehicle facing to the left direction with use of reverse and forward gear
fields.opt_3: It is driving a vehicle facing the forward direction with use of reverse and forward gear
fields.opt_4: It is driving a vehicle facing to opposite direction with use of reverse and forward gear
fields.right_opt: It is driving a vehicle facing to opposite direction with use of reverse and forward gear

fields.question: Describe the warning sign?
fields.opt_1: They are red in color, triangular in shape with apex facing downwards
fields.opt_2: They are red in color, triangular in shape with apex facing upwards
fields.opt_3: They are red in amber, triangular in shape with apex facing upwards
fields.opt_4: They are red in amber, triangular in shape with apex facing downwards
fields.right_opt: They are red in color, triangular in shape with apex facing upwards

fields.question: List down two examples of caravan?
fields.opt_1: Side car
fields.opt_2: Mobile toilet/clinic
fields.opt_3: Public service buses
fields.opt_4: A & B
fields.right_opt: A & B

fields.question: Write down all the mechanical signals of a saloon car?
fields.opt_1: Headlights, parking lights, brake lights,reverse lights, interior lights and hazards lights
fields.opt_2: Headlights, parking lights, brake lights,reverse lights, indicators,number plates light, interior lights and hazards lights
fields.opt_3: Headlights, parking lights, brake lights,number plates light, interior lights and hazards lights
fields.opt_4: Headlights, parking lights, brake lights,reverse lights, indicators,number plates light, and hazards lights
fields.right_opt: Headlights, parking lights, brake lights,reverse lights, indicators,number plates light, interior lights and hazards lights

fields.question: Why must all vehicles be insured?
fields.opt_1: For security purposes
fields.opt_2: To comply with traffic laws
fields.opt_3: to control costs in case of an accident
fields.opt_4: For ease of repairs in case of an accident
fields.right_opt: For security purposes

fields.question: What is the meaning of a PDL?
fields.opt_1: Practice driving license
fields.opt_2: Private driving license
fields.opt_3: Provisional driving license
fields.opt_4: Public driving license
fields.right_opt: Provisional driving license

fields.question: What is the use of speed governors and safety belts?
fields.opt_1: To comply with traffic rules and requirements
fields.opt_2: To improve safety for road users
fields.opt_3: To minimize casualties in case of an accident
fields.opt_4: To maintain a specific speed given on highway according to the vehicle you are driving and to reduce the number of injuries during accidents
fields.right_opt: To maintain a specific speed given on highway according to the vehicle you are driving and to reduce the number of injuries during accidents

fields.question: Class A signs are subdivided into THREE main groups, Which of the following is NOT among them?
fields.opt_1: Priority signs(stop sign)
fields.opt_2: Compulsory signs(all vehicles must keep left)
fields.opt_3: Regulatory signs(no entry)
fields.opt_4: Warning signs (stop)
fields.right_opt: Warning signs (stop)

fields.question: As a driver, when you come across river bed crossing explain how do you cross it?
fields.opt_1: Use judgment to determine if its safe to cross
fields.opt_2: Ask people in the area if its safe to cross
fields.opt_3: One has to know how deep is the river before you cross by deeping the stick in the water
fields.opt_4: If you are using a powerful vehicle just cross
fields.right_opt: One has to know how deep is the river before you cross by deeping the stick in the water
